or until you cause the sky to fall upon us in pieces as you have\n   threatened us; or you bring Allah and the angels before us face\n   to face,
or until a garden of date-palms and grapes be created for you and\n   you cause rivers to flow in it;
They say: "We will not believe in you until you cause a spring to\n   gush forth from the earth for us,
In this Qur'an We have used different methods to make the people\n   understand the Message, yet the majority of them persist in\n   unbelief.

Declare: "Even if all human beings and Jinns combined their
   resources to produce the like of this Qur'an, they would never be
   able to compose the like thereof, even if they backed up each
   other as best as they could."
But your Rabb has blessed you with this knowledge; surely His\n   goodness to you has been great indeed.
If We want, We can definitely take away all that which We have\n   revealed to you: then you will find none to help you in getting\n   it back from Us.
They put you questions about Ar-Ruh (the Spirit). Tell them: "The\n   Spirit is at my Rabb's command and I am not given any knowledge\n   of it but a little."
O Prophet say to them: "Everyone acts according to his own\n   disposition; but only your Rabb knows best who is on the Right\n   Way."

Man is a strange creature: when We bestow Our favors on man, he
   turns his back and drifts off to one side (instead of coming to
   Us) and whenever evil touches him, he gives himself up to
   despair.
We have revealed the Qur'an which is a healing and a mercy to the\n   believers, while to the wrongdoers it adds nothing but loss.
and declare, "The Truth has come and falsehood has vanished, for\n   falsehood by its nature is bound to perish."
During the prayer say: "Rabb! Make my entrance, the entrance with\n   truth and make my exit, the exit with truth and grant me a\n   supporting authority from your presence;"
During a part of the night, pray Tahajjud, an additional prayer\n   for you (O Muhammad), very soon your Rabb may exalt you to\n   'Maqam-e-Mahmood' (a station of great glory).
Establish Salah from the decline of the sun till the darkness of\n   the night (Zuhr, Asr, Maghrib and Isha) and read at Fajr (dawn);\n   for the reading at Fajr is witnessed (by the angels).
This has always been Our Sunnah (course of action) with regards\n   to those Rasools whom We sent before you, and you will find no\n   change in Our Sunnah (course of action).
They almost scare you off the land, to expel you from it. If they\n   do so, they will not be able to stay here much longer after you.
In such a case We would have given you double punishment in this\n   life and in the life hereafter. Then you would have found no\n   helper against Our wrath.
Had We not strengthened your faith, you might have made some\n   compromise with them.
O Muhammad! These people have tried to entice you from Our\n   revelations, hoping that you might fabricate something in Our\n   name. Had you done that, they would have made you their friend.
But those who have played blind in this world will be blind in\n   the hereafter, rather worse than blind in finding the Way to\n   Salvation.

Just imagine the scene of that Day when We shall call every
   community with their respective Imams (leaders): then those who
   will be given their 'book of deeds' in their right hand will read
   it with pleasure and they will not be wronged in the least.

It is Our favor that We have honored the children of Adam,
   blessed them with conveyances on land and sea, provided them with
   good and pure things and exalted them above many of Our
   creatures.

Or, are you confident that when again you go back to sea He will
   not smite you with a violent tempest and drown you for your
   thanklessness? If that happens, then you will not find anyone who
   can question Us regarding this end of yours.
Are you confident that He will not cave in the land beneath you,\n   or let loose a deadly tornado upon you? Then you may not find\n   anyone to protect you.

Whenever any adversity strikes you at sea, all those to whom you
   pray besides Him forsake you except He; yet when He brings you
   safe to the land, you turn your backs upon Him. Indeed, man is
   ever ungrateful.
Your Rabb is the One Who drives your ships across the ocean, so\n   that you may seek His bounty; indeed He is ever Merciful to you.
- as for My servants, you shall have no authority over them. Your\n   Rabb is sufficient as their Guardian."

You may try to allure whomsoever you can with your seductive
   voice, muster against them all your cavalry and infantry, be
   their partner in their riches and their children, and promise
   them what you will - the promises of shaitan are nothing but
   deception
Allah said: "Go away! Hell is your reward, and the reward of\n   those who follow you, an ample reward it shall be.
Then he asked: "Tell me, is this the one whom You have honored\n   above me? If You give me respite till the Day of Resurrection, I\n   will certainly uproot all but a few of his descendants."

Recall the occasion when We said to the angels: "Prostrate
   yourselves before Adam." They all prostrated except Iblees
   (Shaitan), who replied: "Should I prostrate to the one whom You
   have created from clay?"

Remember, O Muhammad! We told you that your Rabb encompasses
   mankind. We have made the Vision which We showed you, and the
   cursed tree of Zaqqum which is mentioned in the Qur'an, a test
   for these people of Makkah. We are giving them warning to be
   fearful but it only increases their inordinate transgression.

We refrain from sending signs (miracles) only because the men of
   former generations treated them as false. For example, We sent
   the she-camel to the people of Thamud - a manifest sign - but
   they laid violent hands on her. We send the signs only by way of
   warning, and if people reject the sign after receiving it, they
   are doomed.
There is not a town but We shall destroy it before the Day of\n   Resurrection or punish it with a severe punishment; this fact has\n   been recorded in the Eternal Record.

Those to whom they pray, themselves seek the means of access to
   their Rabb - trying as to who can be more near - they hope for
   His Mercy and fear His punishment, for the punishment of your
   Rabb is terrible indeed.
Say: "Pray if you will to those whom you assert besides Him; they\n   have neither the power to relieve you from any distress nor to\n   change it."
Your Rabb is fully aware of all that is in the heavens and in the\n   earth. We have exalted some prophets above the others and gave\n   Zaboor (the Psalms) to Dawood.
Your Rabb is fully aware of your circumstances. He may be\n   merciful to you if He wants, or He may punish you if He pleases.\n   O Prophet, We have not sent you to be their guardian.
Tell My servants that they should speak only what is the best.\n   Surely shaitan stirs up trouble among them. The fact is that\n   shaitan is an open enemy to mankind.
It will be on the Day when He will call you and you will raise up\n   in response to it, with His praise, and you will think that you\n   remained in the state of death but a little while."

or even something harder than this that you may think of." Then

Tell them: "(Yes, most certainly you shall be brought back to\n   life), even if you be stones or iron
They say: "What! When we are reduced to bones and dust, shall we\n   really be raised up again into a new creation?"
See what sort of examples they make up about you! They have\n   surely gone astray and cannot find the Right Way.

We are quite aware what they really wish to hear when they listen
   to you, and what they say when they converse in private. These
   wrongdoers say to one another: "The man you follow is surely
   bewitched"
We cast a veil upon their hearts and make them hard of hearing,\n   so they do not comprehend it. When in the Qur'an you mention His\n   Oneness, they turn their backs in disgust.
When you recite the Qur'an, We put a hidden barrier between you\n   and those who do not believe in the hereafter.

The seven heavens, the earth and all beings therein declare His
   glory. There is not a single thing but glorifies Him with His
   praise, but you do not understand their hymns of His glory. The
   fact is that He is very Forbearing, Forgiving.
Glory be to Him! He is far above the things that they say about\n   Him.
Tell them: If there were other gods besides Him as the mushrikin\n   say, they would have certainly tried to find a way to dethrone\n   the Master of the Throne.
We have explained things in various ways in this Qur'an so that\n   they may receive admonition, yet it has only added to their\n   aversion.
What! Has your Rabb preferred to give you sons and adopted angels\n   as daughters for Himself? Certainly you are uttering a monstrous\n   statement.
This is but a part of the wisdom which your Rabb has revealed to\n   you. Do not associate other deities as object of worship, lest\n   you should be cast into hell, blameworthy rejected.
All these and their evil aspects are hateful in the sight of your\n   Rabb.
You shall not walk arrogantly on the earth, for you can neither\n   rend the earth asunder nor attain the height of the mountains.

You shall not follow anyone blindly in those matters of which you
   have no knowledge, surely the use of your ears and the eyes and
   the heart - all of these, shall be questioned on the Day of
   Judgement.
You shall give full measure, when you measure, and weigh with\n   even scale; this is the best way and will prove to be the best in\n   the end.

You shall not go near the property of an orphan, except with the
   good intention of improving it, until he attains his maturity.
   You shall fulfill your pledges; surely you shall be held
   accountable for your pledges.

You shall not kill anyone whom Allah has forbidden, except for
   just cause under the law. If anyone is killed unjustly, We have
   granted the right of retribution to his heir, but let him not
   carry his vengeance too far in killing the culprit through taking
   the law in his own hands, as he is supported by the law.
You shall not commit adultery; surely it is a shameful deed and\n   an evil way (opening the door to other evils).
You shall not kill your children for fear of want, for it is We\n   Who provide sustenance for them as well as for you; surely\n   killing them is a great blunder.
Surely your Rabb gives abundantly to whom He pleases and\n   sparingly to whom He wills, for He is aware of the condition of\n   His servants and observes them closely.
You shall neither tie your hands to your neck (be miserly) nor\n   stretch them forth to their utmost reach (be prodigal), lest you\n   sit back, blameworthy, destitute.
You shall speak courteously to needy persons if you are waiting\n   for your Rabb's bounty and you lack the means to assist them.
- as spendthrifts are the brethren of shaitan and shaitan is ever\n   ungrateful to His Rabb.
You shall give to your relatives their due and to the needy and\n   to the wayfarers. You shall not be a spendthrift
Your Rabb knows best what is in your hearts. If you do good\n   deeds, certainly He is most forgiving to those who turn to Him in\n   repentance.
You shall lower to them your wings of humility and pray: "O Rabb!\n   Bestow on them Your blessings just as they cherished me when I\n   was a little child."

Your Rabb has decreed to you that: You shall worship none but
   Him, and you shall be kind to your parents; if one or both of
   them live to their old age in your lifetime, you shall not say to
   them any word of contempt nor repel them and you shall address
   them in kind words.
Do not associate another deity with Allah, lest you sit back,\n   condemned, forsaken.
See how We have exalted some over others, and certainly the\n   hereafter is more exalted and greater in excellence.
We bestowed on all - these as well those - out of the bounties of\n   your Rabb; the bounties of your Rabb are not confined.
He that desires the life of the hereafter and strives for it as\n   best as he can provided he is a Believer, the endeavor of every\n   such person will be accepted.

He that desires the transitory things of this life, We readily\n   grant him such things as We please to whomsoever We want, then We\n   condemn him to hell, where he will burn, disgraced and rejected.
How many generations have We destroyed since Nuh's time?\n   Sufficient is your Rabb to note and see the sins of His servants.

Whenever We have intended to destroy a town, it was because We
   sent Our commandments to its people who were leading easy lives
   but they showed disobedience; as a result Our judgement was
   passed, and We razed that city to the ground.

He that seeks guidance, shall be guided to his own advantage, but
   he that goes astray does so to his own loss. No bearer shall bear
   the burden of another on the Day of Judgement. And during your
   worldly life, We do not inflict punishment until We send forth a
   Rasool to make truth distinct from falsehood.
saying: "Here is your book of deeds: read it. Today you yourself\n   are sufficient to take your own account."
We have fastened the fate of every man to his own neck, and on\n   the Day of Judgment We shall bring out for him a book spread wide\n   open,

We have made the night and the day as two signs. We enshrouded
   the night with darkness and gave light to the day, to enable you
   to seek the bounty of your Rabb, and that you may compute the
   years and count the numbers. Thus, We have set forth all things
   in detail.
Yet man prays for evil as fervently as he ought to pray for good,\n   and mankind is ever hasty.
and at the same time it gives warnings to those who do not\n   believe in the hereafter, that We have prepared for them a\n   painful punishment.
Surely this Qur'an guides to the Way which is perfectly straight\n   and gives the good news to the believers who do good that they\n   shall have a magnificent reward;
Now your Rabb may again be merciful to you; but if you repeat the\n   same behavior, We will repeat the punishment, and in the\n   hereafter, We have made hell a prison for such unbelievers.

If you did good, it was to your own benefit; but if you did evil,
   it proved to be bad for your own selves. Then, when the promise
   for your second forewarning came to be fulfilled, We sent another
   army (the Romans) to disfigure your faces and to enter your
   Temple as the former entered it before, and they utterly
   destroyed all that they laid their hands on.
Then after this, We afforded you an opportunity to overpower them\n   and helped you with wealth and sons and granted you more\n   manpower.

When the promise for the first of the two fore warnings came to
   be fulfilled, We sent against you Our servants (the Assyrians)
   who gave you a terrible warfare: so they rampaged through your
   homes to carry out the punishment of which you were forewarned.
Besides this We forewarned the Children of Israel in their Holy\n   Book that you will do mischief in the land twice through becoming\n   arrogant transgressors and each time you will be punished.
You are the descendents of those whom We carried in the Ark with\n   Nuh, and he was indeed a grateful devotee."
We gave Musa (Moses) the Book and made it a guide for the\n   Children of Israel, saying: "Do not take any other protector\n   besides Me.

Glory be to Him Who took His devotee (Muhammad) one night from
   Masjid-al-Haram (in Makkah) to Masjid-al-Aqsa (in Jerusalem),
   whose vicinity We have blessed, so that We may show him some of
   Our signs: surely He is the One Who is the Hearer, the Observer.
for Allah is with those who fear Him and adopt the righteous\n   attitude.
Be patient - for your patience is not but with the help of Allah\n   - do not grieve over them and do not distress yourself because of\n   their plots,

If you have to retaliate, let your retaliation be commensurate
   with the wrong which was done to you; but if you endure with
   patience, the best reward indeed is for those who endure with
   patience.

Call people to the Way of your Rabb with wisdom and best advice,
   and reason with them, if you have to, in the most courteous
   manner: for your Rabb knows best who strays from His Way and He
   knows best who is rightly guided.
As for the Sabbath, it was ordained for those who differed about\n   its observance. Surely your Rabb will judge between them on the\n   Day of Judgment about that over which they differ.
And now We have revealed to you Our will, saying: "Follow the\n   faith of Ibrahim the upright, he was not of the mushrikin."
We gave him a good life in this world, and in the hereafter he\n   will be among the righteous.
He was always grateful for the favors of Allah, Who chose him and\n   guided him to a Right Way.
In fact Ibrahim (Abraham) was a nation in himself, an upright man\n   obedient to Allah, and he was not of the mushrikin.
Yet your Rabb is forgiving and merciful towards those who do\n   something wrong through ignorance, but later repent and mend\n   their ways.
To the Jews, We prohibited those things which We have already\n   mentioned to you, and it was not We Who imposed the hardships on\n   them but they imposed those hardships on themselves.
Brief is their enjoyment of this life, and they shall have a\n   painful punishment.
You shall not falsely declare with your tongues: "This is lawful,\n   and that is forbidden," in order to ascribe false things to\n   Allah, for those who forge lies against Allah will never prosper.

He has only forbidden you to eat carrion (meat of dead a body),
   blood, pork, and that over which any name other than Allah has
   been invoked. But if one is forced by necessity, intending
   neither to break the Divine Law nor to transgress limits, then
   surely Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
So eat of the good and lawful things which Allah has provided for\n   you; and be grateful to Allah for His favors, if you are sincere\n   in His worship.
A Rasool was sent to them from among themselves, but they denied\n   him; so the punishment overtook them because they were\n   wrongdoers.

Allah gives you an example of a town which was enjoying security
   and peace, receiving its provisions in abundance from every
   quarter, but it became ungrateful to the favors of Allah. As a
   result, Allah made its residents taste the consequences of their
   doings, through inflicting upon them misfortunes of hunger and
   fear.
On the Day of Judgement every soul will come pleading for itself\n   and every soul will be paid in full for what it has done, and\n   they shall not be dealt with unjustly.

On the other hand, Allah is most surely forgiving and
   compassionate towards those who had to leave their homes after
   being persecuted because of their faith, struggled hard and
   remained steadfastly patient.
There is no doubt that in the hereafter they will be the losers.
Such are those whose hearts, ears and eyes are sealed by Allah;\n   and they are the ones who are heedless.
This is because such people love the life of this world more than\n   the hereafter, and that Allah does not guide those who knowingly\n   reject faith.

Anyone who is forced to deny faith after its acceptance, while
   his heart remains loyal to the faith shall be absolved; but any
   who denies faith willingly after its acceptance and open his
   breast to unbelief, shall incur the wrath of Allah and shall be
   sternly punished.
Surely those who do not believe in the revelations of Allah, are\n   the ones who forge the falsehood and they are the ones who are\n   liars!
In fact, Allah does not show guidance to those who do not believe\n   in His revelations and they will have a painful punishment.
We know very well what they say about you, O Muhammad: "A certain\n   man teaches him." But the man they allude to speaks a foreign\n   language while this (The Qur'an) is in eloquent Arabic.
Say, "The Holy Spirit (Gabriel) has brought it down piecemeal\n   intact from your Rabb to strengthen the faith of the believers,\n   and to give guidance and good news to the Muslims."

When We substitute one verse in favor of another to elaborate
   with different examples - and Allah knows best what He reveals in
   stages - they say: "You are but a forger." The fact is that most
   of them do not understand.
His authority is only over those who befriend him and commit\n   shirk by his temptation.
surely he has no authority over those who believe and put their\n   trust in their Rabb.
When you recite The Qur'an, seek Allah's protection from the\n   accursed Shaitan,

Whoever does righteous deeds, whether male or female, provided he
   is a believer, We shall surely grant him a new life, a life that
   is good, and We will certainly reward such people according to
   the noblest of their deeds in the hereafter.
Whatever is with you is transitory and what is with Allah is\n   everlasting. We will certainly reward those who are patient\n   according to the noblest of their deeds.
Do not sell the covenant of Allah for a petty price. Certainly\n   Allah's reward is far better than all your gain, if you but knew\n   it.

O believers! Do not take oaths to deceive each other, lest your
   foot slip after being firmly fixed upon guidance; and taste the
   evil consequences for debarring others from the Way of Allah and
   incur a mighty punishment.
If Allah wanted, He could have made you all one nation, but He\n   lets go astray whom He wants and guides whom He pleases: but most\n   certainly you will be questioned about all your actions.

Do not behave like that woman who had spun her yarn strongly and
   then had herself broken it into pieces; nor take your oaths for
   mutual deceit so that one people may take undue advantage over
   the other, for Allah puts you to trial by these oaths; and on the
   Day of Judgment He will certainly reveal to you the truth about
   which you differed.

Fulfill the covenant of Allah when you have pledged to do so, and
   do not break your oaths after you have sworn them; for swearing
   in His name you have made Allah your surety; surely Allah has
   knowledge of all your actions.
Allah commands doing justice, doing good to others, and giving to\n   near relatives, and He forbids indecency, wickedness, and\n   rebellion: He admonishes you so that you may take heed.

O Muhammad, warn them about that Day when We shall call a witness
   from every nation to testify against it, and We shall call you O
   Muhammad to testify against your people: that is why We have sent
   down to you this Book (The Qur'an) to explain everything - a
   guide, a blessing and good news for Muslims.
As for those who disbelieve and debar others from the Way of\n   Allah, We shall punish them all the more for their misdeeds.
They shall tender their submission to Allah that Day: and the\n   gods of their own inventions will leave them in the lurch.

When the mushrikin see their deities whom they associated with
   Allah, they will say: "Our Rabb! Here are our 'associate gods'
   whom we used to invoke besides You." At this their deities will
   toss their statement back at them saying: "You are liars!"
When the wrongdoers face the punishment, it will neither be\n   lightened for them nor will they be granted a delay.

Do they realize what will happen on that Day when We shall call a
   witness from every nation? Then the unbelievers will neither be
   allowed to put forward any excuse nor will they receive any
   favor.
They recognize the favors of Allah, yet they deny them; most of\n   them are ungrateful disbelievers.
If they still give no heed to you O Muhammad, you need not worry,\n   for your duty is only to convey the message clearly.

Allah has provided you shades from the sun out of what He has
   created. He has granted you resorts in the mountains, has granted
   you garments to protect yourselves from heat; and coats of armor
   to protect you during your wars. Thus He completes his favors to
   you, so that you may become Muslims.

Allah has made your homes the place for your rest, and animal
   skins for tents like houses so that you may find them light when
   you travel and easy to pitch when you stop; while from their
   wool, fur, and hair He provides you household items and articles
   of convenience for your prescribed term of life.
Do they not see the birds, that wing their flight in the air\n   towards the sky? Who holds them up but Allah? Surely in this\n   there are signs for the true believers.
Allah brought you forth from the wombs of your mothers when you\n   knew nothing, and He gave you hearing, sight and intelligence so\n   that you may give thanks to Him.

Allah Alone has knowledge of the unseen things of the Heavens and
   the Earth. As for the taking place of the Hour of Judgment, it
   will be like a twinkling of an eye or even quicker: surely Allah
   has power over everything.

Well! Allah gives you another example of two men: one of them is
   dumb and has no ability do anything - a burden on his master -
   whenever he sends him on an errand, he does nothing useful. Can
   he be equal to the one who executes orders properly and follows
   the directions in a Right Way?

Allah gives you another example of two men: one of them is a
   slave, the property of the other, and has no power over anything;
   and the other man is one on whom We have bestowed Our bounty,
   from which he freely spends secretly and openly. Ask them: "Are
   those two men equal?" Praise be to Allah - most of them do not
   understand this simple thing.
Therefore, compare none with Allah. Surely Allah knows and you do\n   not know.
They worship those deities other than Allah, who neither provide\n   them anything for sustenance from the heavens or the earth, nor\n   have any power to do so?

It is Allah Who has made for you mates from your own species and
   He is the One Who gives you sons and grandsons through those
   wives, and provides for you good things to eat: will they then,
   after knowing all that, believe that falsehood and disbelieve
   Allah's favors?

Allah has made some of you excel in sustenance over the others;
   those who are so favored, do not give away their sustenance to
   their slaves so as to make them their equals. How can you think
   that Allah will allow other deities to be His equals? Would they
   refuse to acknowledge the favors of Allah?

Allah is the One Who created you, then He causes you to die;
   there are some amongst you whose lives are prolonged to an abject
   old age so that they know nothing after having known much. In
   fact Allah is the All-Knowing , Almighty.

and feed on every kind of fruit and follow the smooth ways of
   your Rabb. From its belly comes forth a syrup of different
   colors, which contains a healing for mankind. Certainly in this
   there is a sign for those who think.
Behold! Your Rabb inspired the bees to build their hives in the\n   mountains, in the trees, and in anything which men may build for\n   beekeeping,
Likewise in the fruits of the date-palm and the grapes, from\n   which you derive intoxicants and wholesome food, certainly there\n   is a sign for those people who use their common sense.
Surely there is a lesson for you in cattle. We give you to drink\n   of what is in their bellies, between bowels and blood - pure milk\n   - pleasant for those who drink it.

Allah sends down water from the sky, and with it gives life to
   the land after it has been dead (this Qur'an is being sent to
   serve the same purpose). Surely in this example there is a sign
   for those who listen.

We have revealed to you the Book (The Qur'an) so that you may
   clearly explain to them the reality of those things in which they
   differ - it is a guidance and blessing for those people who
   believe.

By Allah! We sent Rasools before you (O Muhammad) to other
   nations; but shaitan made their deeds seem fair to them so they
   did not believe, he is their patron today, and they shall have a
   painful punishment.

They attribute to Allah what they themselves hate. Their tongues
   mouth the lie that they will have a good reward. Let there be no
   doubt: the only thing they will have is hell, and they will be
   sent ahead of the others.

If Allah were to punish mankind for its wrongdoing, He would not
   leave even an animal around the wrongdoers, but He gives them
   respite for an appointed time. But when their appointed time
   comes, they can neither stay behind for a moment nor can they go
   before it.
Those who do not believe in the hereafter set an evil example,\n   while Allah applies the highest example, for He is the Mighty,\n   the Wise.

He hides himself from his people because of the bad news he has
   heard, asking himself whether he should retain her with disgrace
   or bury her in the dust. Beware! Evil is the judgement they make
   about Allah.
Whenever the news of a female child is announced to any one of\n   them, his face darkens and he chokes with inward gloom.
They ascribe daughters to Allah - Glory be to Him! - But for\n   themselves, they would like to have what they desire (sons).
They set aside a portion of what We have provided them with, for\n   those deities about whom they know nothing. By Allah! You shall\n   most certainly be questioned about the lies you fabricate.
as if to show their ingratitude for the favors that We bestow on\n   them! Enjoy yourselves; soon you will come to know the\n   consequences.
Yet no sooner does He relieve you from the distress than some of\n   you begin to associate others with Him,
Whatever blessings you enjoy are from Allah, and when touched by\n   distress, He is the One to Whom you cry for help.
To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth and His\n   Deen (laws or ways of life) is followed in the universe - would\n   you then fear any one other than Allah?
Allah has commanded: "You shall not worship two gods: there\n   exists only One God, I am the One Whom you should fear."
they fear their Rabb Who is above them, and they do whatever they\n   are commanded to do.
To Allah prostrate all the creatures of the heavens and the\n   earth, including the angels; and they are not arrogant:
Do they not see how every object that Allah has created casts its\n   shadow right and left, prostrating itself to Allah in all\n   humility?
Or that He may seize them after alerting them about the danger?\n   Yet your Rabb is Beneficent, Merciful.
Or that He may not seize them in the course of their journey\n   leaving no way for their escape?
Do those who plot evil deeds feel secure that Allah will not cave\n   in the earth beneath them or that the scourge will not come to\n   them from directions that they did not suspect?

We sent those Rasools with clear signs and scriptures; and now We
   have sent down the reminder to you (O Muhammad), so that you may
   explain clearly to mankind as to what was sent to them so that
   they may think about it.

The Rasools We sent before you, O Muhammad, and to whom We
   revealed Our Message, were also human beings. You (O people of
   Makkah), may ask those who have the Reminder (The people of the
   Book), if you don't know this fact yourself.
those who bear ills with patience and put their trust in their\n   Rabb.

For those who migrated for the sake of Allah after persecution,
   We will certainly provide them a good abode in this life and the
   reward of the hereafter will be much greater, if they but knew
   what a happy end awaits
As for its possibility, when We intend to do anything which We\n   want, We need only say, "Be," and it is.
It will be fulfilled so that He may manifest to them the Truth\n   about which they differ, and so that the rejecters of Truth may\n   know that they were indeed liars.

They solemnly swear their strongest oaths by Allah: "Allah will
   never raise the dead to life." Why not? It is a promise which He
   has made binding on Himself, though most among mankind may not
   know it.
No matter how eager you may be for their guidance, you should\n   know that Allah does not guide those whom He let go astray and\n   such people will have no helpers.

No doubt We raised in every nation a Rasool, saying: "Serve Allah
   and keep away from Taghut (Satanic forces)." After that, Allah
   guided some of them while deviation proved true against the
   others. So travel through the earth and see what was the end of
   those who denied Our Message.

The mushrikin say: "If Allah wanted, neither we nor our
   forefathers would have worshipped any one else but Him, nor made
   anything unlawful without His will." Such excuses were put
   forward also by those who went before them. Yet Rasools have no
   more responsibility than to convey the Message clearly.
At the end, the evil results of their deeds overtook them, and\n   the very scourge at which they mocked, hemmed them in.

Are these unbelievers waiting for the angels to come down to take
   their lives or the commandment of your Rabb to come to pass for
   their doom? So did those who went before them. It was not Allah
   who was unjust to them, but they were unjust to themselves.
- such pious people the angels cause to die, saying: "Peace be\n   upon you! Enter the paradise because of the good deeds you have\n   done."
- Gardens of Eden will they enter, beneath which rivers flow,\n   having therein all that they wish to have. Thus shall Allah\n   reward the righteous,

On the other hand when the righteous people are asked: " What is
   it that your Rabb has revealed?" They say: "That which is the
   best." Good is the reward for such righteous people in this world
   and the home of the hereafter will be even better. How splendid
   will be the home for the righteous
Now go ahead and enter the gates of Hell, there you will abide\n   forever." In fact, very awful will be the abode of the arrogant.

- those whom the angels cause to die while they were still

   "Where are those deities you associated with Me concerning whom

Those before them also plotted against the Truth, but Allah shook
   their edifice through its foundation, and its roof caved in on
   them; and the torment came at them from where they did not even
   suspect.
Let them bear their own burden in full and that of those whom\n   they have misled in their ignorance. Alas! Evil is the\n   responsibility they are taking.
When they are asked: "What is it, that your Rabb has revealed?"\n   They say: "Fictitious stories of the ancients!"
Allah surely knows what they conceal and what they reveal;\n   certainly He does not love the arrogant.
Your God is One God; as for those who do not believe in the\n   hereafter, they have faithless hearts and are puffed up with\n   arrogance.
They are dead, not living; they do not even know when they will\n   be raised to life again.
Those whom they invoke besides Allah have created nothing, but\n   are themselves created.
and Allah knows what you conceal and what you reveal.

Is then, He, Who has created all this, like one who cannot\n   create? Why don't you understand?
and likewise made landmarks and the stars for your guidance.
He has set mountains on the earth - lest it should move away with\n   you. He also made rivers and roads so that you may find your way;

It is He Who has subjected the sea to your service, that you may
   eat fresh meat therefrom and that you may bring out of it
   ornaments to wear; and you see that ships plough their course
   through it. He has done all this so that you may seek His bounty
   and so that you may pay thanks to Him.
In the Earth He has created things of different colors: surely\n   there is a sign in this for those who want to learn a lesson.

He has subjected to your service the night and the day, the sun
   and the moon: and likewise the stars also serve you by His
   command: surely there are signs in this for people who use their
   common sense.
With it He grows for you crops, olives, date-palms, grapes, and\n   every kind of fruit: surely there is a great sign in this for\n   those who think.
It is He Who sends down water from the sky, which provides\n   drinking water for you and brings forth fodder to pasture your\n   cattle.
It is up to Allah to show the Right Way, when there exist some\n   crooked ways. If Allah wanted He could have guided you all.
He has also created horses, mules, and donkeys for you to ride\n   and put on show, and He has created other things which are beyond\n   your knowledge.
They carry your heavy loads to far-off towns that you could not\n   otherwise reach without painful toil; indeed your Rabb is Kind\n   and Merciful.
How pleasant they look to you when you bring them home in the\n   evening and drive them to pasture in the morning.
He created cattle, which provide you clothing, food, and other\n   benefits.
He created man from a drop of semen, yet he is an open contender.
He has created the heavens and the earth to manifest the Truth;\n   Exalted be He above the shirk that they practice.

He sends down His angels with inspiration of His Command to whom\n   He pleases of His servants, saying: "Warn the people that there\n   is no one else worthy of worship except Me, therefore fear Me."
Allah's commandment has come, so do not seek to hurry it on.\n   Glory be to Him and Exalted be He above the shirk (associating\n   other gods with Allah) that they practice!
and worship your Rabb until there come to you which is certain\n   (death).

those who place other deities alongside Allah, will soon come to\n   know their folly.

They replied: "We are giving you true good news; you should not\n   be of those who despair."
He said: "Are you giving me the good news of a son when I have\n   become old? What kind of good news you are giving?"
They answered: "Do not be afraid of us! We have come to you with\n   good news of a son endowed with knowledge."
They entered upon them and said: "Peace be upon you!" But he\n   replied: "Surely we are afraid of you."
Tell them about the guests of Ibrahim (Abraham).
but at the same time My punishment is also the most painful\n   punishment.

and it will be said to them: "Enter into these in peace and\n   security."
The righteous will be in the midst of the gardens and fountains\n   of paradise
which has seven gates, each gate will be assigned to a separate\n   group from among them."
They will be all destined for Hell,
- you will not have any authority over My devotees except those\n   misguided ones who follow you.

Allah said: "Get out of here, you are accursed.

except Iblees (The Satan); he refused to join those who\n   prostrated.

when I complete his moulding and breath into him of My spirit,\n   kneel down and prostrate before him."
Remember when your Rabb said to the angels: "I am about to create\n   a man from sounding clay, black mud moulded into shape;
while before him We had created Jinn from smokeless fire.
We created man from sounding clay, black mud moulded into shape;
Surely your Rabb will gather them together; surely He is Wise,\n   Knowledgeable.
Certainly We have full knowledge of those who have gone before\n   you and certainly We know those who will come later.
Certainly it is We Who give life and cause to die, and We are the\n   inheritors of all.
We send the fertilizing winds and send down water from the sky\n   for you to drink; it is not you who hold the storage of this\n   wealth.
There is nothing which is not in Our inexhaustible treasure and\n   sent down in appropriate measure.
and We provided therein means of sustenance for you and many\n   other creatures to whom you do not provide.
We have spread out the earth and set mountains upon it; and\n   caused to grow every suitable thing therein,
Any shaitan that steals a hearing, there follows him a fiery\n   comet.
and We have guarded them from every accursed shaitan.
It is We who have decked the heavens with constellations and made\n   them good looking for the beholders;
still they would have said, 'Our eyes have been dazzled; rather\n   we have been bewitched.'"
Even if we had opened a gate in Heaven and they ascend through it\n   and keep on ascending,
that they do not believe in it (The Qur'an), despite the examples\n   of the people who passed before them.
Thus do We let doubt creep into the hearts of the criminals;
but whenever a Rasool came to them, they mocked him.
Certainly We sent Rasools before you among the early nations;
Surely We have revealed this reminder (The Qur'an); and We will\n   surely preserve it Ourself.
O Muhammad, tell them: "We do not send down the angels except for\n   just cause (to execute Our scourge), and when they come, people\n   are not given respite.
Why don't you bring us the angels, if you are of the truthful\n   ones?"
They say: "O you to whom the reminder (The Qur'an) is being\n   revealed! You are surely insane.
No people can forestall their doom, nor can they postpone it.
Never did We destroy a town whose term of life was not ordained\n   beforehand.
Leave them alone to eat and enjoy themselves and be deluded by\n   false hopes, for soon they will find out the Truth.
The Day will come when the unbelievers will wish that they were\n   Muslims.
Alif L'am Ra. These are the verses of the Divine Book, the\n   Glorious Qur'an which makes the things clear.
This is a proclamation for mankind: let them take warning\n   therefrom; let them know that He is the One and Only - worthy of\n   worship - and let the men of understanding learn a lesson.
Allah will requite each soul according to its deeds; surely Allah\n   is swift in taking the account.
their garments will be made of tar and their faces will be\n   covered with flames.
and on that Day you will see the criminals bound together in\n   chains,
Warn them of the Day when the earth will be changed to a\n   different earth and the heavens as well, and all of them will\n   stand before Allah, the One, the Irresistible;
Never think that Allah will break the promise which He made to\n   His Rasools: surely Allah is Mighty in power, the Lord of\n   Retribution.
They hatched their plots but their plots were well within the\n   sight of Allah, even though these were such which could move\n   mountains.
When you lived among those people who had wronged their souls, it\n   was explained to you how We dealt with them and We even described\n   for you their examples."

O Muhammad forewarn mankind of the Day when Our punishment will
   overtake them; when the wrongdoers will say: "Our Rabb! Give us a
   little more respite: we will answer Your call and follow the
   Rasools!" But it will be said to them, "Are you not the same
   people who once swore that you would never suffer a decline?
they will be running in terror with their heads uplifted, staring\n   but seeing nothing and their hearts utterly vacant.
Never think that Allah is unaware of what these unjust people are\n   doing. He is only deferring their case to that Day when their\n   eyes will be fixedly open,
Our Rabb! Forgive me and my parents and all believers on the Day\n   when the accountability will take place."
O Rabb! Make me and my descendants establish Salah. Our Rabb!\n   Accept my prayer.
Praise be to Allah who has given me Isma`il (Ishmael) and Ishaq\n   (Isaac) in my old age. Indeed my Rabb hears all prayers.
Our Rabb! Certainly You know what we conceal and what we reveal.\n   In fact, nothing in the earth or in heaven is hidden from Allah.

Our Rabb! I have settled some of my offspring in a barren valley
   near Your Sacred House. Our Rabb! I have done this in the hope
   that they would establish Salah, therefore, turn the hearts of
   the people toward them and provide them with fruits so that they
   may give thanks.

O Rabb! They have indeed led many people astray (and they might
   led my descendants astray as well). Therefore, only those who
   follow my ways belong to me and I leave those to You who disobey
   me; surely You are Forgiving, Merciful.
Remember when Ibrahim (Abraham) said: "My Rabb! Make this city a\n   city of peace and save me and my sons from the worship of idols.
He has given you all that you could ask for and if you want to\n   count the favors of Allah, you will never be able to count them.\n   In fact, man is unjust, thankless.
The sun and the moon are also assigned for your benefit, which\n   steadfastly pursue their courses, to cause the night and the day\n   for your benefit.

It is Allah , Who has created the heavens and the earth. He sends
   down water from the sky with which He brings forth fruits for
   your sustenance. He has made the ships subservient to you, that
   they may sail through the sea by His command; and likewise the
   rivers are made for your benefit.

O Prophet, tell My devotees who have believed, to establish Salah
   (regular five times daily prayers) and spend in charity openly
   and secretly out of the sustenance which We have given them,
   before the coming of that Day in which there will neither be
   trading nor any friendship.
They set up equals with Allah to mislead people from His Way.\n   Tell them: "Well, you may enjoy yourself for a while, but your\n   final destination is going to be hellfire."
Which is hell! Wherein they shall burn, an evil place to live.
Have you not seen those people who have responded to the favors\n   of Allah with ingratitude and drive their people into the House\n   of Perdition?
With firm words, Allah makes the believers steadfast in the life\n   of this world and in the hereafter; but Allah lets the wrongdoers\n   go astray. Allah does what He pleases.
But the example of an evil word is that of an evil tree, which is\n   torn out from the earth and has no stability.
It yields its fruits in every season by Allah's leave. Allah\n   cites these examples for men so that they may learn a lesson from\n   them.
Do you not see how Allah gave the example of comparing a good\n   word with a good tree, whose roots are firm and its branches are\n   in the sky?

Those who believe and do good deeds will be admitted to Paradise,
   beneath which rivers flow, to live therein forever with the
   permission of their Rabb, and their greetings therein will be:
   "Peace!"

Once the matter has been decided, Shaitan will say: "In fact, the
   promises which Allah made to you were all true; I too made some
   promises to you but failed to keep any of them. However, I had no
   power over you. I just invited you, and you accepted my
   invitation. Now! Do not blame me, but blame yourselves. I cannot
   help you, nor you can help me. I reject what you did before; that
   you associated me with Allah. Certainly such wrongdoers will have
   painful punishment."

When all people appear before Allah, those who were weak in the
   world will say to those who thought themselves mighty: "We were
   your followers. Now! Can you do anything to relieve us from the
   punishment of Allah?" They will reply: "Had Allah given us
   guidance, we would have guided you. Now it makes no difference
   whether we panic or bear it with patience, for there is no escape
   for us."
That is not at all difficult for Allah.
Do you not see that Allah has based the creation of the heavens\n   and the earth on Truth? That He can destroy you if He wills and\n   bring into being a new creation?

The parable of the deeds of those who deny their Rabb is that
   their deeds are like ashes which the wind scatters on a stormy
   day; they will gain nothing from their deeds, and this is to
   stray far away from the goal of getting back to Paradise.
he will sip, but never will be able to swallow. Death will\n   surround him from all sides, yet he will not die; beyond that\n   there will be horrible punishment.
Hell is next for him wherein he will be given festering water to\n   drink;
The Rasools called for judgement, (and when the judgement was\n   passed) every tyrant opposer of the Truth was disappointed.
and give you the land to dwell in after they are gone! This is\n   the reward for the ones who dread My eminence and fear My\n   threats."
Finally the unbelievers said to their Rasools: "Return to our\n   religion or we will expel you from our land." But their Rabb\n   revealed His will to them: "We shall destroy the wrongdoers

What reason do we have not to put our trust in Allah, when He has
   already guided us to the ways of our lives? We shall certainly
   endure your persecution patiently, and those who want to put
   their trust, should put their trust in Allah."

Their Rasools said to them: "It is true that we are human like
   yourselves, but Allah bestows His grace of appointing a Rasool on
   such of His servants as He pleases. It is not in our power to
   bring you any sign except by Allah's permission, and in Allah let
   the believers put their trust.

Their Rasools responded: "Are you doubting the existence of
   Allah, Who is the Creator of the heavens and the earth? He is the
   One Who invites you so that He may forgive your sins and give you
   respite till your appointed term." They said: "You are nothing
   but a human like us! You only wish to turn us away from the
   worship of those deities whom our forefathers used to worship.
   Bring us some clear sign."

Have you not heard the information of those who passed away
   before you, the people of Nuh (Noah), `Ad and Thamud, and those
   who came after them? Allah Alone knows them. Their Rasools came
   to them with clear signs; but they bit their hands with their
   mouths and said: "Certainly we reject the Message with which you
   have been sent and certainly we strongly doubt the faith to which
   you invite us."
Musa said: "If you and all the dwellers of the earth become\n   thankless, you should know that He does not stand in need of any\n   of you, surely Allah is the Self-sufficient, Praiseworthy."
Remember that your Rabb had forewarned: "If you are grateful, I\n   will bestow abundance upon you, but if you are ungrateful (then\n   you should know that) My punishment will be terrible indeed."

Recall! When Musa said to his people: "Remember Allah's favor to
   you when He delivered you from the people of Fir'on (Pharaoh),
   who subjected you to cruel afflictions, putting your sons to
   death and sparing your females, and in this there was a
   tremendous trial from your Rabb."

We sent Musa with Our signs, saying: "Lead your people out of
   utter darkness into light, and remind them to learn lessons from
   the Days of Allah (Divine history)." Surely there are signs in
   this for every steadfast, thankful person.

We have not sent any Rasool except that he speaks the language of
   his own people, so that he could explain to them clearly. Then
   Allah leaves in error whom He will and guides whom He pleases: He
   is the Mighty, the Wise.
They are the ones who love the life of this world more than the\n   hereafter, who debar others from the Way of Allah and seek to\n   make it crooked: they have gone far astray into error.
the One to Whom belongs all that is in the heavens and the earth.\n   Woe to the unbelievers, for they will be sternly punished.

Alif L'am Ra. O Muhammad! This is a Book which We have revealed
   to you so that you may bring mankind out of utter darkness (ways
   of ignorance) to the light; by the leave of their Rabb, to the
   Way of the Mighty, the Praiseworthy (Allah),
The unbelievers say: "You are no Rasool." Say: "Allah is\n   all-sufficient witness between me and you, and so are those who\n   have knowledge of the Book."

Those unbelievers who have passed before them also devised plots;
   but Allah is the Master of all planning. He knows the actions of
   every soul. Soon the unbelievers will come to know who will get
   the home of paradise in the hereafter.

Do they not see that We are gradually reducing the land in their
   control through curtailing its borders? When Allah commands,
   there is none to reverse His command and He is swift in taking
   accountability.

O Muhammad! Whether We let you see, within your lifetime, a part
   of what We threaten them with or cause you to die before We smite
   them, your mission is only to deliver the Message and it is for
   Us to take accountability.
Allah abrogates and confirms what He pleases - with Him is the\n   Master Copy of the Book.

We have sent forth other Rasools before you and given them wives
   and children and it was never in the power of a Rasool to show
   any miracle without the sanction of Allah. For each period there
   was a Book:

With these instructions, We have revealed this commandment in the
   Arabic language. Now, if you follow their vain desires after real
   knowledge has come to you, there will be none to save you or
   protect you against the wrath of Allah.

O Prophet, some of those to whom We have given the Book rejoice
   at what is revealed to you, while there are some factions who
   deny a part of it. Tell them: "I am commanded to worship Allah
   and to associate none with Him. To Him I invite you and to Him I
   shall return."

As for the paradise which the righteous have been promised, it is
   like this: rivers flow beneath it; eternal are its fruits, and
   eternal are its shades; such is the reward of the righteous. But
   the reward of unbelievers is the fire.
They shall be punished in the life of this world, still more\n   grievous is the punishment of the hereafter, and there is none to\n   protect them from Allah.

What! Are they so audacious that they ascribe partners to Allah,
   Who watches minutely over each and every soul and knows all that
   it does? O Prophet ask them: If Allah Himself has set them up as
   His partners then tell me their names! Do you mean to inform Him
   of something new that He Himself does not know on this earth, or
   do you merely utter empty words?" Nay! Indeed their foul devices
   seem fair to the unbelievers, for they have been debarred from
   the Right Way; and there is none to guide those whom Allah has
   let go astray.
Rasools have been mocked before you (O Muhammad), but I always\n   gave respite to the unbelievers and finally I seized them, so see\n   how terrible was My requital!

Even if there were a Qur'an that could move mountains, cleft the
   earth asunder or make the dead speak (do you think the result
   would have been different?) Surely all things are subject to
   Allah's command. Have not yet the believers been satisfied that
   if Allah wanted, He would have certainly guided the whole of
   mankind? As for the unbelievers, the disaster will not cease to
   afflict them every now and then or to crouch at their very
   doorsteps because of their misdeeds, until the promise of Allah
   is fulfilled; surely Allah will not fail His promise.

O Muhammad! We have sent you among a nation before whom other
   nations have passed away; so that you may recite to them Our
   revelations which We have sent down to you; yet they are
   rejecting the Compassionate (Allah). Say: "He is my Rabb! There
   is no god but Him. In Him I have put my trust and to Him shall I
   return."
As for those who believe and do good deeds, for them there will\n   be prosperity and a beautiful place of final return."
- such are the ones who have believed and whose hearts find\n   satisfaction in the remembrance of Allah. Beware! It is the\n   remembrance of Allah which provides tranquility to the hearts.
The unbelievers say: "Why has no sign been sent down to him\n   (Muhammad) from his Rabb?" Say: "In fact Allah lets him go astray\n   who wants, and guides to Himself those who turn to Him

Allah grants abundantly His provisions to whom He will and
   sparingly to whom He pleases. The unbelievers rejoice in the life
   of this world: but brief indeed is the comfort of this worldly
   life as compared to the life of the hereafter.

As for those who break their covenant with Allah after confirming
   it and cut asunder what Allah has commanded to be joined and
   create mischief in the land, they are the ones on whom there
   shall be a curse and they are the ones who will have a terrible
   home.
saying: "Peace be upon you for all that you steadfastly endured\n   in the world. Now! How excellent will be the home of the\n   hereafter!"

- the Paradise of perpetual bliss: they will enter into it along
   with their righteous forefathers, their spouses and their
   descendants. The angels will come to welcome them from every
   side,

also they are the ones who are patient, seek the pleasure of
   their Rabb, establish Salah, spend secretly and openly out of the
   sustenance which We have provided for them, and repel evil with
   good - they are the ones for whom there is the home of the
   hereafter
and they are the ones who join together what Allah has commanded\n   to be joined, who fear their Rabb and are afraid of the terrible\n   reckoning;
They are the ones who fulfill their covenant with Allah and do\n   not break their pledge;

How can the one who knows that which has been revealed to you
   from your Rabb is the Truth, be like the one who is blind to this
   fact? Only those who use their common sense benefit from this
   reminder.

There is an excellent reward for those who respond to the call of
   their Rabb. As for those who do not respond to Him - even if they
   had all that is in the earth, and as much besides, to offer as a
   ransom in order to save themselves from punishment, it would be
   of no use. They are the ones who will have terrible reckoning;
   their abode will be hell - what an evil resting place.

He sends down water from the skies and each channel starts
   flowing according to its measure, and then the torrent bears a
   swelling foam - like the scum which appears from metal which are
   melted in the furnace for making ornaments and utensils. By such
   examples Allah depicts truth and falsehood. As for the scum, it
   is thrown away, being worthless, but that which is useful for the
   mankind remains behind on the earth. In this way Allah cites
   examples to make His message clear.

Ask them: "Who is the Rabb of the heavens and the earth?" If they
   hesitate to respond, say: "Allah." Then ask them: "When this is
   the fact, why do you take other deities, besides Him, who do not
   control any benefit or harm even to themselves, as your
   protectors?" Say: "Are the blind and the seeing equal? Or can the
   darkness and light be equal?" If that is not so, then, have their
   shoraka' (other deities they worship) created any thing like His
   creation which has made the matter of creation doubtful for them?
   Say: "Allah Alone is the Creator of everything and He is the One,
   the Irresistible."
Whatever is in the heavens and the earth do prostrate before\n   Allah Alone willingly or unwillingly, and so do their shadows in\n   the mornings and evenings.

Praying to Him Alone is the right thing. The other deities they
   pray to, besides Him, cannot answer their prayers. They are like
   a man who stretches forth his hands to the water and asks it to
   reach his mouth. It cannot reach his mouth this way; likewise the
   prayer of the unbelievers is nothing but a fruitless effort.

The thunder declares His glory with His praises and so do the
   angels with awe. He is the One Who sends thunderbolts and smites
   with them whomever He wants. Yet these unbelievers dispute
   concerning Allah; He is mighty in strength.
He is the One Who shows you lightning, which causes fear and\n   hope, and brings up heavy clouds (with rain).

Each person has been assigned guardian angels before him and
   behind him, who watch him by the command of Allah. The fact is
   that Allah never changes the condition of a people until they
   intend to change it themselves. If Allah wants to afflict a
   people with misfortune, none can ward it off, nor they can find
   any protector besides Him.
It is the same to Him whether any of you speak in secret or\n   aloud, whether anyone hides under the darkness of night or walks\n   about in broad daylight.
He has perfect knowledge of both the visible and the invisible.\n   He is the Great, the Most High.
Allah knows what every female bears in her womb. He is fully\n   aware of what decrease or increase (miscarriage or a long wait)\n   takes place in the womb. Everything has a due measure with Him.
The unbelievers say: "Why is not a sign sent down to him\n   (Muhammad) from his Rabb?" You are nothing but a Warner and every\n   nation was assigned a guide.

They ask you to hasten on the evil (Allah's scourge) rather than
   the good, although there have been instances of exemplary
   punishments before them. In fact your Rabb is the Lord of
   Forgiveness to the people, notwithstanding their wrongdoing; and
   it is also the fact that your Rabb is stern in retribution.

Now, if there is anything that feels strange, then strange is
   their saying: "What! When we will become dust, could we then be
   raised to a new life again?" They are the people who have denied
   their Rabb, they are the ones who will have yokes around their
   necks and they are the ones who will be the inmates of hellfire
   to live therein forever.

In the earth there are tracts side by side: gardens of grapes,
   cornfields and palm trees with single and double trunks - they
   are all watered with the same water, yet We make some of them
   excel others in taste. Surely in this, there are signs for people
   who use their common sense.

He is the One Who spread out the earth and placed thereon
   mountains and rivers, created fruits of every kind in pairs, two
   and two and makes the night cover the day. Certainly in these
   things there are signs for those who use their common sense.

Allah is the One Who raised the heavens without any pillars that
   you can see, then firmly established Himself on the throne of
   authority and subjected the sun and the moon to His law - each
   one pursuing its course for an appointed time. He regulates all
   affairs. He has spelled out His revelations so that you may
   believe in meeting your Rabb.
Alif L'am M'im Ra. These are the Verses of the Book; that have\n   been revealed to you, O Muhammad, from your Rabb are the very\n   Truth, but most of the people do not believe in this.

There is a lesson in these stories of former people for the men
   of common sense. This story of Yusuf revealed in the Qur'an is
   not an invented tale, but a confirmation of previous scriptures -
   a detailed exposition of all things, and is a guidance and
   blessing for the people who believe.

Respite was granted until the Rasools gave up hope of their
   people and realized that they were being treated as liars, Our
   help came to them and We delivered those whom We pleased; and Our
   scourge was not averted from the criminal people.

All the Rasools that We sent before you, O Muhammad, were human
   beings, to whom We sent Our Revelations after choosing them from
   the people of their town. Have these unbelievers not traveled
   through the land and seen what was the end of those who passed
   away before them? From their destiny you should know that the
   home of the hereafter is better for those who are righteous. Why
   don't you understand?
Tell them plainly: "This is my way. I invite you to Allah with\n   sure knowledge which I and my followers possess. Glory be to\n   Allah, and I am not one of the mushrikin."
Do they feel secure that Allah's scourge will not fall on them,\n   or that the Hour of Doom will not come upon them suddenly while\n   they do not suspect it?
As a result most of them who believe in Allah also commit shirk.
There are many signs in the heavens and the earth which they pass\n   by; yet they pay no attention to them!
even though You do not demand any recompense for this\n   information. This Qur'an is nothing but a reminder for all the\n   people of the worlds.
Yet strive as you may, most men are not going to become\n   believers,
O Muhammad, this story which We have revealed to you is a tale of\n   the unseen; for you were not there with (the brothers of Yusuf)\n   when they collectively conspired and schemed against him.

O Rabb! You have indeed given me a kingdom and taught me the
   interpretation of dreams. O, the Creator of the heavens and the
   earth, You are my Protector in this world and in the hereafter,
   make me die as a Muslim and admit me among the righteous."

After entering the city he helped his parents to seats on the
   throne, and they all fell down in prostration before him. "This,"
   said Yusuf to his father, "is the interpretation of my dream
   which I dreamt long before. My Rabb has really made it come true.
   It was His grace that He took me out of prison and brought you
   all here from the desert even though Shaitan had stirred up
   strife between me and my brothers. For sure my Rabb fulfills His
   plan in mysterious ways. Surely He is the One Who is the
   Knowledgeable, the Wise.
When they came to Yusuf, he asked his parents to lodge with\n   himself, and said: "Now enter the city. Allah willing, you will\n   live here in peace."
He replied: "Soon I will ask my Rabb for your forgiveness; surely\n   He is the One who is the Forgiving, the Merciful."
They said: "Father! Pray for the forgiveness for our sins. We\n   have indeed done wrong."

But when the bearer of the good news arrived, he cast the shirt\n   of Yusuf over his face and he regained his sight. Then he said:\n   "Didn't I tell you that I know from Allah what you do not know?"
The people, who heard him, said: "By Allah! You are still\n   suffering from your old illusion."
When the caravan started (from Egypt) their father (who was in\n   Ken'an) said: "Certainly I feel the scent of Yusuf, even though\n   you may think I am out of my mind."
Go, take this shirt of mine and cast it over the face of my\n   father, he will recover his sight. Then come back to me with all\n   the members of your family."
Yusuf said: "There is no blame on you today. May Allah forgive\n   you! He is the most Merciful of those who show mercy!
They said: "By Allah! Certainly Allah has preferred you over us.\n   We have indeed been guilty."

This took them by surprise, and they cried: "What! Are you really
   Yusuf?" He said: "Yes! I am Yusuf and this is my brother. Allah
   has indeed been gracious to us. In fact as for the righteous and
   patient; Allah really does not let the reward of the righteous be
   wasted."
Hearing this, Yusuf, who could contain himself no longer,\n   replied: "Do you know what you did to Yusuf and his brother while\n   acting out of ignorance?"

When they went back to Egypt and entered Yusuf's office, they
