O Mankind! Worship your Rabb Who created you and created those\n   who came before you; by doing this you may expect to guard\n   yourself against evil.

The lightning terrifies them as if it was going to snatch away
   their eyesight; whenever it flashes they walk on; when it becomes
   dark, they stand still. And if Allah wanted He could have totally
   taken away their hearing and their sight; for Allah has power
   over everything.

Or another example is that of a dark storm-cloud in the sky
   charged with thunder and lightning. They press their fingers into
   their ears at the sound of each stunning thunderclap for fear of
   death: Allah is encircling the unbelievers from all sides.
Deaf, dumb, and blind, they will never return to the Right Way.

Their example is that of a man who kindled a fire; when it
   illuminated all around him Allah took away the light (their
   eyesight) and left them in utter darkness: they could see
   nothing.
These are the people who barter guidance for error: but their\n   bargain is profitless and they are not going to be guided.
Allah will throw back their mockery on them and leave them alone\n   in their trespasses; so they wander to and fro like blind.
When they meet the believers they say: "We are believers," but\n   when they are alone with their shaitans, they say: "We are really\n   with you, we were only mocking the believers."
When it is said to them: "Believe as the others believe" they\n   sarcastically ask: "Should we believe like fools?" Be aware! They\n   themselves are the fools, if only they could understand.
Be aware! They are the ones who make mischief but they do not\n   realize it.
When it is said to them: "Do not make mischief on earth," they\n   say: "We make peace."
There is a disease of deception in their heart; and Allah lets\n   their disease increase, and they shall have painful punishment\n   for the lies they have told.
They try to deceive Allah and the believers. However, they\n   deceive none except themselves yet they do not realize it.
There are some people who say: "We believe in Allah and the Last\n   Day" yet they are not true believers.
Allah has sealed their hearts and their hearing, their eyes are\n   covered, and there is a grievous punishment for them.
In fact, as for those who reject Faith; it is the same, whether\n   you warn them or you don't, they will not believe.
They are on True Guidance from their Rabb and they are the ones\n   who will attain salvation.
who believe in this Revelation (The Qur'an) which is sent to you\n   (O Muhammad) and the Revelations which were sent before you\n   (Torah, Psalms, Gospel...) and firmly believe in the Hereafter.
who believe in the Unseen, who establish Salah (five regular\n   daily prayers) and spend in charity out of what We have provided\n   for their sustenance;

This is The Book in which there is no doubt. (Since its Author,
   Allah, the Creator of this universe, possesses complete
   knowledge, there is no room for doubt about its contents.) It is
   a guide for those who are God conscious,
Alif Lam M'im.
The Way of those whom You have favored;  not of those who have\n   earned Your wrath, or of those who have lost The Way.
O'Allah! Guide us to The Right Way.
O'Allah!  You Alone we worship and You Alone we call on for help.
Master of the Day of Judgment.
The Compassionate, the Merciful.
All praise is for Allah, the 'Rabb' of the Worlds.
In the name of Allah, the Compassionate, the Merciful.
The Compassionate (Allah).
Who taught you the Qur’an.
Created man.
And taught him how to speak and convey his feelings and thoughts.
The sun and the moon move along their computed courses.
The shrubs and the trees prostrate in adoration.
He has raised the heaven on high and created the balance:
Don’t ever tamper with this balance.
Therefore, you also establish weight with justice and do not give less measure.
He laid out the earth for His creatures,
With all its fruits and palms having sheathed clusters,
And grain with husk and scented herbs.
So, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
He created man from sounding clay similar to pottery,
And created jinns from smokeless fire.
So, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
He is the Rabb of the two easts and the Rabb of the two wests.
So, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
He has made the two oceans apparently meeting together,
Yet, between them is a barrier which they cannot cross.
So, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
He produces pearls and coral, from both of them.
So, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
His are the ships looming up like mountains on the sea.
So, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
All that exists on the earth will perish,
But the Face of your Rabb will remain full of Majesty and Glory.
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
All who dwell in the heavens and the earth, implore Him for their needs, every day He is busy in some mighty task.
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
O you, the two burdens (jinns and  mankind)! Soon We shall find the time to call you to account.
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?

You, the assembly of jinns and men! If you have the power to get away from the boundaries of the heavens and the earth (to escape from His punishment), then get away! You cannot get away except with Our authority.
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
The flames of fire and molten brass will be unleashed on you both, jinns and men, and you will not be able to defend yourselves.
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
When the heaven splits asunder and reddens like red-oil.
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
On that Day neither man nor jinn will need be asked about his sins.
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
Because the sinners will be recognized by their faces and they shall be seized by their forelocks and their feet.
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
It will be said to them: “This is the hell which the criminals had denied."
They shall wander to and fro between fire and hot boiling water.
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
For those who fear standing before their Rabb, there will be two gardens.
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
Having shady trees with lush green branches.
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
In both of them there will be two flowing springs.
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
In both of them there will be two kinds of every fruit.
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
They will recline on couches lined with rich brocade while the fruit of the gardens will be within their easy reach.
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
Therein will be chaste virgins, whom neither man nor jinn has touched before.
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
So beautiful as though they were rubies and corals.
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
Could the reward for goodness be anything but goodness?
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
And besides these two there shall be two other gardens.
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
Densely shaded with dark green trees.
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
In both of them there will be two gushing springs.
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
Each planted with fruit trees, dates and pomegranates.
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
In each of them, there will be chaste and beautiful virgins.
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
Hûris (beautiful damsels) sheltered in their tents.
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
Whom neither man nor Jinn has ever touched before.
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
Reclining on green cushions and beautiful fine carpets.
Then, O jinns and men, which of your Rabb’s favors will both of you deny?
Blessed be the name of your Rabb, Owner of Majesty and Honor.
